intro: Epidendrum barbae, commonly known as the beard orchid, is a species of orchid native to Central and South America. It is characterized by its pendulous, racemose inflorescence and showy, fragrant flowers that are typically yellow or orange with a contrasting lip. The plant is epiphytic, meaning it grows on the surface of trees or other structures without deriving nutrients from them.
